titleStmt.title: A mixture of scholasticall divinity, with practicall, in severall tractates: vvherein some of the most difficult knots in divinity are untied, many darke places of Scripture cleared, sundry heresies, and errours, refuted, / by Henry Ieanes, minister of God's Word at Chedzoy in Sommerset-shire.
Mixture of scholasticall divinity, with practicall. Part 1
titleStmt.author: Jeanes, Henry, 1611-1662.

titleStmt.title: A mixture of scholasticall divinity, with practicall, in severall tractates: vvherein some of the most difficult knots in divinity are untied, many darke places of Scripture cleared, sundry heresies, and errours, refuted, / by Henry Ieanes, minister of God's Word at Chedzoy in Sommerset-shire.
Mixture of scholasticall divinity, with practicall. Part 1
titleStmt.author: Jeanes, Henry, 1611-1662.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by H. Hall printer to the University, for Thomas Robinson.,

notesStmt.note: "A treatise concerning the fulnesse of Christ" (identified as Thomason E.873[1]) has separate pagination, and dated title page on 2A1.
E4 is a vertical half-title which reads "Ieanes of scholasticall & practicall divinity", with the words "scholasticall & practicall" enclosed in brackets.
A second part was published in 1660.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
